  • Constructor Details

    • HttpSender

      @Deprecated public HttpSender(ConnectionParam connectionParam, boolean useGlobalState, int initiator)
      Deprecated.
      (2.12.0) Use HttpSender(int) instead, refer also to setUseGlobalState(boolean).
      Constructs an HttpSender.

      The initiator is used to indicate the component that is sending the messages when the HttpSenderListeners are notified of messages sent and received.

      Parameters:
      connectionParam - the parameters used to setup the connections to target hosts
      useGlobalState - true if the messages sent/received should use the global HTTP state, false if should use a non shared HTTP state
      initiator - the ID of the initiator of the HTTP messages sent
      See Also:
      • ConnectionParam.getHttpState()
      • HttpSenderListener
      • HttpMessage.getRequestingUser()

    • HttpSender

      public HttpSender(int initiator)
      Constructs an HttpSender.

      Refer to setUseGlobalState(boolean) to know how the HTTP state is managed.

      The initiator is used to indicate the component that is sending the messages when the HttpSenderListeners are notified of messages sent and received.

      Parameters:
      initiator - the ID of the initiator of the HTTP messages sent
      Since:
      2.12.0
      See Also:
      • HttpSenderListener

      Returns:
      the SSLConnector used by the sender.

    • setUseGlobalState

      public void setUseGlobalState(boolean enableGlobalState)
      Sets whether or not the global state should be used. Defaults to true.

      If enableGlobalState is true the HttpSender will use the HTTP state given by the connections options iff the HTTP state is enabled there otherwise it doesn't have any state (i.e. cookies are disabled). If enableGlobalState is false it uses a non shared HTTP state.

      Note: The actual state used is overridden when getUser(HttpMessage) returns non-null.

      Parameters:
      enableGlobalState - true if the global state should be used, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.8.0
      See Also:
      • isGlobalStateEnabled()
      • setUseCookies(boolean)

    • isGlobalStateEnabled

      public boolean isGlobalStateEnabled()
      Tells whether or not the global HTTP state is enabled.
      Returns:
      true if the global HTTP state is enabled, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.12.0
      See Also:
      • setUseGlobalState(boolean)

    • setUseCookies

      public void setUseCookies(boolean shouldUseCookies)
      Sets whether or not the requests sent should keep track of cookies.
      Parameters:
      shouldUseCookies - true if cookies should be used, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.9.0
      See Also:
      • setUseGlobalState(boolean)

    • sendAndReceive

      public void sendAndReceive(HttpMessage message, Path file) throws IOException
      Downloads the response (body) to the given file.

      The body in the given message will be empty.

      Parameters:
      message - the message containing the request to send.
      file - the file where to save the response body.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurred while sending the request or while downloading.
      Since:
      2.12.0
      See Also:
      • setFollowRedirect(boolean)

    • sendAndReceive

      public void sendAndReceive(HttpMessage message, HttpRequestConfig requestConfig, Path file) throws IOException
      Downloads the response (body) to the given file, using the given request configurations.

      The body in the given message will be empty.

      Parameters:
      message - the message containing the request to send.
      requestConfig - the request configurations.
      file - the file where to save the response body.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurred while sending the request or while downloading.
      Since:
      2.13.0

    • getUser

      public User getUser(HttpMessage msg)
      Gets the user set in this HttpSender if any, otherwise the one in the given HttpMessage.
      Parameters:
      msg - usually the message being sent, that might have a user.
      Returns:
      the user set in the HttpSender or in the given HttpMessage. Might be null if no user set.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the given message is null.
      Since:
      2.4.1
      See Also:
      • setUser(User)
      • HttpMessage.getRequestingUser()

    • setUserAgent

      @Deprecated public static void setUserAgent(String userAgent)
      Deprecated.

      Parameters:

    • addListener

      public static void addListener(HttpSenderListener listener)
      Adds the given listener to be notified of each message sent/received by each HttpSender.

      The listener might be notified concurrently.

      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to add.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the given listener is null.
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • removeListener

      public static void removeListener(HttpSenderListener listener)
      Removes the given listener.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to remove.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the given listener is null.
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • setUser

      public void setUser(User user)
      Set the user to scan as. If null then the current session will be used.
      Parameters:
      user -

    • getClient

      @Deprecated public org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient getClient()
      Deprecated.

      Returns:
      the HTTP client implementation.

    • setRemoveUserDefinedAuthHeaders

      public void setRemoveUserDefinedAuthHeaders(boolean removeHeaders)
      Sets whether or not the authentication headers ("Authorization" and "Proxy-Authorization") already present in the request should be removed if received an authentication challenge (status codes 401 and 407).

      If true new authentication headers will be generated and the old ones removed otherwise the authentication headers already present in the request will be used to authenticate.

      Default is false, i.e. use the headers already present in the request header.

      Processes that reuse messages previously sent should consider setting this to true, otherwise new authentication challenges might fail.

      Parameters:
      removeHeaders - true if the authentication headers already present should be removed when challenged, false otherwise

    • setMaxRetriesOnIOError

      public void setMaxRetriesOnIOError(int retries)
      Sets the maximum number of retries of an unsuccessful request caused by I/O errors.

      The default number of retries is 3.

      Parameters:
      retries - the number of retries
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if retries is negative.
      Since:
      2.4.0

    • setMaxRedirects

      public void setMaxRedirects(int maxRedirects)
      Sets the maximum number of redirects that will be followed before failing with an exception.

      The default maximum number of redirects is 100.

      Parameters:
      maxRedirects - the maximum number of redirects
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if maxRedirects is negative.
      Since:
      2.4.0

    • setAllowCircularRedirects

      @Deprecated public void setAllowCircularRedirects(boolean allow)
      Deprecated.
      (2.12.0) No longer supported, the circular redirects are allowed always. If needed they can be prevented with a custom HttpRedirectionValidator.
      Sets whether or not circular redirects are allowed.

      Circular redirects happen when a request redirects to itself, or when a same request was already accessed in a chain of redirects.

      Since 2.5.0, the default is to allow circular redirects.

      Parameters:
      allow - true if circular redirects should be allowed, false otherwise
      Since:
      2.4.0

    • sendAndReceive

      public void sendAndReceive(HttpMessage message, HttpRequestConfig requestConfig) throws IOException
      Sends the request of given HTTP message with the given configurations.
      Parameters:
      message - the message that will be sent
      requestConfig - the request configurations.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameters is null
      IOException - if an error occurred while sending the message or following the redirections
      Since:
      2.6.0
      See Also:
      • sendAndReceive(HttpMessage, boolean)
